SEARCH
Package model

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
model.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class manages tasks in the Task Manager application. It handles task modification, removal, addition, and provides access to task attributes.

  • Constructor Summary

    Private constructor to enforce singleton pattern and initialize data structures.

    • getInstance

      public static Controller getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the Controller class.
      Returns:
      The Controller instance.

    • undo

      public boolean undo()
      Undoes the last action by restoring the previous state of the controller from the stacks.
      Returns:
      True if the undo operation is successful, false if there's nothing to undo.

    • saveToStacks

      public void saveToStacks()
      Saves the current state of the controller to the undo stacks.

    • loadFromStacks

      public void loadFromStacks()
      Loads the previous state of the controller from the undo stacks.

    • modifyTask

      public boolean modifyTask(String title, int option, String newValue)
      Modifies a task based on the provided options.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task to modify.
      option - The modification option (1 for title, 2 for description, 3 for priority).
      newValue - The new value for the modification.
      Returns:
      True if the modification is successful, false otherwise.

    • removeTask

      public boolean removeTask(String title)
      Removes a task with the given title.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task to remove.
      Returns:
      True if the task is removed successfully, false otherwise.

      Saves data to JSON files using the FileManager.

    • addTask

      public boolean addTask(String title, String description, int priorityLevel)
      Adds a new task with the given title, description, and priority level.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task.
      description - The description of the task.
      priorityLevel - The priority level of the task.
      Returns:
      True if the task is added successfully, false otherwise.
